title.narrative: Support for UNDP's Crisis, Conflict Prevention and Recovery (BCPR) Trust Fund

description.narrative:
UNDP is working to promote development through capacity building both in order to prevent (and thus, if possible, avoid crises, man-made or natural), and to rebuild communities that are emerging from crisis. UNDP manages the Thematic Trust Fund for Conflict Prevention and Reconstruction (CPR TTF), to which the Danish contribution is allocated.
BCPR works through UNDP¿s country offices on conflict prevention, reduction of risks and reconstruction through: national capacity building including conflict analysis, mainstreaming of conflict analysis in national programs and the strengthening the capacity of the UN country office. The focus is very much on the early stages of post-conflict situations, where the necessary national capacity must be built, as part of the aid efforts, in order for the government and administrative apparatus to take on responsibility and ensure service delivery as quickly as possible.
